content: Even when everything is going according to plan, the unexpected happens.
Rescuing and adopting two dogs was totally unplanned, but one of the best decisions I ever made.

Jake was a 90 pound mix of Rhodesian Ridgeback and Chow with an unpredictable nature. He would be warm and affectionate one minute and then start barking up a storm the next. But five minutes after meeting Jake, I knew he was my dog. And Jake knew I was his human.
Jake and I were an instant family.
Some of our best days were spent traveling.
We would hit the road and visit places across the country – the Grand Canyon, Hoover Dam,
We camped out, just like my summers growing up, and enjoyed the beauty of America’s wilderness areas.
I’ll never forget one night Jake woke me up trying to get out of the tent by opening the zipper with
his nose.  For once he wasn’t barking and I soon found out why. A bear had wandered into our camp!
Jake was too busy trying to protect me - like a grizzly bear would defend her cub.
Park rangers told us the next morning that the bear had been stealing food and had broken into
some cars. I was glad that Jake was smart enough to stay silent and that I was smart enough to keep
him inside the tent. We could have been bear food!
A few years after I adopted Jake, I’d seen a dog wandering around my neighborhood who could have been
Jake’s twin. It was clear no one was caring for him. He had no collar, was nearly blind, was hungry, and suffering from heartworms.
On Thanksgiving Day my neighbor called and said,
“Your dog got loose! He’s sitting on your front lawn.”
Jake was safe inside, right beside me. The hungry, wandering dog had chosen me.
I named him Scout and took him in as my own
Scout was a heavily muscled, affectionate, mild-mannered dog - a nice contrast to Jake’s considerably
more excitable personality. I had two nearly identical dogs; both of whom came to me unexpectedly, both of

Sometimes it’s the unplanned, sudden circumstance that ends up bringing joy.

Adopting Jake and
Scout taught me to go with the flow and enjoy the unexpected.
